detailsOfAchievement: ï¶ Pioneer in conducting Neethimelas (Lok Adalats) conducted 252 Neethimelas so far benefiting more than one lakh people in Kerala from Trivandrum to Kasargode. ï¶ Created a culture of â€œMediation and settlement of cases out of Courtâ€, through ADR methods across the State. ï¶ A State-level Accredited Agency of KELSA (Kerala State Legal Services Authority) PCSJ has given accreditation by KESLA for the conduct of Lok Adalat & Legal Literacy and Legal Aid Programs in the State of Kerala. ï¶ â€œTotal Legal Literacy for Keralaâ€ a massive awareness campaign on â€œLaws for the Common Manâ€ aiming 100% legal literacy in Kerala organized 1708 legal camps across Kerala. ï¶ Para-Legal training Courses of different duration ranging from one week to three months for Women, Tribes, Trade Union Workers, Saksharatha Workers, Youth etc. of Kerala. Conducted 32 Para-legal training courses. ï¶ Women-oriented programs â€“ Awareness Camps on Laws relating to Women, Reproductive Health Rights of Women, Family Dispute Resolution Programs, Vanitha Adalath, Survey on Dowry and Dowry related Programs, Seminars & Workshops on Women Issues at District & State Level, Family Counselling, Research Programs on Women, Exclusive projects for Women & Children in Tsunami affected areas of Kerala supported by UNICEF, HIV/AIDS Eradication and awareness programs for women sponsored by UNDP, Livelihood programs for the most vulnerable groups of Tsunami affected areas, Survey on land tenure of the BPL women and another Survey on Women of the Non-NHG in collaboration with Corporation of Cochin, supported by DFID, UK. ï¶ Child - centered Programs, Life Skill Development Programs, Awareneass Camps on Child Rights in collaboration with Social Welfare Department, Govt. of Kerala, Child Fest for the Orphan and Destitute Children including Street Children, Counselling for children, School Counselling, Adolescent Counselling, Mental Health Clubs for children, summer camps for Children of the Tsunami affected area supported by UNICEF, Research work on Child Abuse by conducting survey on 10,000 school children of Cochin, Survey on Children at Risk, Psycho-social survey on 12,000 children of Tsunami affected area, as a joint venture of PCSJ, UNICEF and Social Welfare Department of Kerala, Project for â€œCreating a Protective Environment for Children of Kerala affected by Tsunamiâ€ supported by UNICEF, Seminars on â€œSituation of the Girl Childâ€ supported by UNICEF, Seminars on â€œChild Prostitution and Traffickingâ€ in all districts of Kerala supported by UNICEF. ï¶ Pro-poor Programs: Land Tenure Project with Corporation of Cochin to improve the housing and sanitation of persons below poverty line and to reduce poverty thereby improving their living environment, Legal aid programs for the poor in undertaking litigation, Mediation and Settlement Daily at PCSJ office through ADR methods. ï¶ Programs for Tribes with emphasis on eco-friendly laws in the tribal belts of Kerala. Conducted Para-Legal Training (residential) of 45-days duration for the Tribal Youth, Seminars & Neethimelas and awareness camps in the tribal belt. ï¶ Service Provider as per Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act 2005 appointed by Govt. of Kerala. ï¶ A Family Counselling Centre sanctioned by Central Social Welfare Board is functioning effectively in PCSJ. ï¶ Cost free Liaison work, advocacy and lobbying work daily at PCSJ office to protect the rights of the poor and the needy in various Govt., Quasi-Govt. and even from private firms / organizations / institutions, already helped more than 10,000 persons. ï¶ Joint venture with Corporation of Cochin to improve health and living conditions in the destitute home of Cochin â€“ the Palluruthy Relief Settlement (PRS) presently having more than 300 inmates, funded by BCF / GSK, New Delhi. ï¶ Public Interest Litigation, PCSJ has undertaken the litigation of various programs affecting the people in common. Vaduthala Dilapidated Bridge, Bandh, Perumbalam Ferry Service, Chengara Issue etc. were taken up by PCSJ. ï¶ UNICEF supported Psycho-Social Project for the Tsunami affected areas of Kerala benefiting more than 50,000 children. ï¶ UNDP supported HIV / AIDS programs for the Tsunami affected areas of Alappuzha & Ernakulam Districts. ï¶ Organized Surveys and Seminars & Mahila Adalats in collaboration with National Commission for Women, New Delhi. ï¶ Conducted many seminars on â€œHuman Rights, Police & Peopleâ€ supported by the National Human Rights Commission. ï¶ AIDS Awareness and Prevention Programs as joint venture of Kerala State AIDS Cell and PCSJ. ï¶ Joint venture with Allgnor Group, USA Education Program on â€œMediation and Settlementâ€ of cases out of Court. ï¶ Legal Awareness Programs with local bodies at the District, Sub-Division, Block-level and Grama Panchayat level. ï¶ Sensitizing Programs on Environmental Programs at the District level. ï¶ Sensitizing programs for the media persons and the public on various socio-legal topics including the Environmental Laws. ï¶ Litigation Free Zone PCSJ in collaboration with KELSA and DLSA, Ernakulam and Cheranalloor Grama Panchayat could make Edayakunnam Desom of the Panchayat Litigation Free Zone, which was declared as such on 11-05-2003 by the then Chairman Sri.Justice K.A. Abdul Gafoor (Retd.).

address: Sangamaithri Farmers Producer Company Ltd, Pallichal, Pallichal PO, Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala Pin 695020
title: Sangamaithri Farmers Producer Company Ltd
detailsOfAchievement: Sanghamaithri Farmers Producer Company Ltd popularly known as Sanghamaithri is a non profit company initially registered as Sanghamaithri karshikolpanna sambharana vipanana sangham was formed during the year 2003 registered under Travancore Cochin charitable societies act 1952 and register number was T724/03. In the year 2011 it was registered as company under Companies Act, 1956 due to a bill passed in the parliament. Sanghamaithris initial investment was Rs.12000/- with 20 farmers. Our main aim is to improve the all round socio-economic status of farmers. Now we have 6000 farmers as members, having 28 number of collection centres and retail outlets, 7 number of mobile vending vehicles and having a built area of 6000 sq.ft. building at our head office. We purchase everything produced by the farmers by offering better price and ready payment and sell it to the consumer at the same price we purchased. We take 5% commision from the farmer from that we give 50% to farmer as bonus and rest for daily activities of the company. In this way both farmers as well as consumers are benefited. Our turnover for the last financial year was about Rs.12 crores. We paid a bonus of about Rs.35 lakhs to the member farmers. We supply seeds, cultivational practice and all other technical inputs and buy the final produce that is Vithu muthal Vipananam Vare. We also help the farmers by giving scholarship to their wards and encouraging their education and also give medical aid to the ailing aged farmers. Our method of cultivation is in traditional way by protecting the soil, water and environment ie. sustainable cultivation. We also conduct field level visiting program and also give training to the final year students of Agriculture College, Vellayani. We have 500ha. of vegetable cultivation, 300ha. of minor tubers, 100ha. of medicinal plants and 1500ha. of banana plants. Our area of operation is mostly limited to 50 panchayats in Thiruvananthapuram district in Kerala state. We have an artificial ripening chamber having a capacity of 20 tons per day by using natural ethylene gas and a chips liner with a capacity of 50 kilograms of chips per hour. The said two things are by us only in the State. We also have an Ultra Modern Training Centre to train the farmers and we have a Farmers Library having more than 10,000 books. We also give training to our member farmers from the prestigious institutions such as PUSA Institute New Delhi, IIVR Varanasi, Sub Tropical Mango Research Institute Lucknow, IIHR Bengaluru, CFTRI Mysore, NRCB Trichy , etc. Our farmers also participated in many exhibitions in New Delhi conducted by Government of India and received many awards and certificates. We need some more training in value addition and marketing in case of coconut. The ultra modern equipments and its availability, its cost and financial funds available at various sources.

title: SANTHIMARGAM SOCIAL WELFARE SERVICE SOCIETY
detailsOfAchievement: Santhimargam is an organisation established for empowering the quality of life of the persons with intellectual disability through special education, vocational training, care and rehabilitation in 1993. The organisation started with the voluntary effort of woman, parents, professionals and public. With humble beginning in a rented accommodation, major challenge was to have own building. The dream project of the organisation is now functioning in a spacious two storied building with all facilities for rehabilitation and accommodation since 2003 may 7th which was constructed with the help of philanthropic organisations and individuals and we remember their contributions thankfully. Govt. of India Bestowed support for the activities of santhimargam by sanctioning Grant-in-aid in the year 1998 onwards. Govt. of kerala Department of education granted recognition to Asadeepam Special School. 1/4/1999 as per Go(p) 74/99/ GEDN dated 31/3/1999. The school was registered under PWD Act by SWD as on 12/9/2002 and later on by DPI. The boarding home provides accommodation to the persons learning in the school or undergoing vocational training with the aim of rehabilitation. There is a facility to accommodate 56 inmates. Training in activities of daily living can be provided to the inmates. The school principal Smt. Mini P.R received the Rotary vocational Excellence â€œBest Teacherâ€ award from Rotary Cochin International in the year 2002 4th sep and Jaycee Humanitarian young citizen Award on 16th August 2003. An occupational therapy unit is started in the year 2012 and appoint a therapist for the training of children with autism and ADHD. Vocational training program with the objective of creating vocational aptitude in children and emphasis on over all development of the child to learn to earn through vocational training. A computer training programme â€œProfessional back office data entry and livelihood programme â€using AMBA curriculum started last year and continuing with the online guidance of AMBA, an organisation from Bangalore . Yearly minimum two awareness / medical camps are conducting for the parents and students. The children participates in cultural activities and other co-curricular activities. Child friendly classroom arrangements, open schooling, special training for children with Autism are very special of this institution. Of all the activities the special school is supported by GOI for which we are thankful to the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment . â€œWe are not really serving but making the intellectually challenged, a partner of our programme.â€
